title: When Thomas Jefferson needed to get away, he went to Poplar Forest
text:
68°   Seasonal affective disorder When Thomas Jefferson needed to get away, he went to Poplar Forest 
LYNCHBURG, Va. — Monticello might be better-known, but Thomas Jefferson’s Poplar Forest retreat is probably where his heart was. Poplar Forest was the place where Jefferson happily escaped the visitors, duties and distractions of his Monticello plantation in Charlottesville, 70 miles away. Today, the partly restored house at Poplar Forest offers visitors a look into the life and mind of the complicated genius who wrote the Declaration of Independence.
